libnacl package¶

Submodules¶

libnacl.base module¶

Implement the base key object for other keys to inherit convenience functions

libnacl.blake module¶

Mimic very closely the python hashlib classes for blake2b

NOTE:
This class does not yet implement streaming the msg into the hash function via the update method
class libnacl.blake.Blake2b(msg, key=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Manage a Blake2b hash

digest()[source]¶

Return the digest of the string

hexdigest()[source]¶

Return the hex digest of the string

libnacl.blake.blake2b(msg, key=None)[source]¶

Create and return a Blake2b object to mimic the behavior of the python hashlib functions

libnacl.dual module¶

The dual key system allows for the creation of keypairs that contain both cryptographic and signing keys

libnacl.public module¶

High level classes and routines around public key encryption and decryption

class libnacl.public.Box(sk, pk)[source]¶

Bases: object

TheBox class is used to create cryptographic boxes and unpack cryptographic boxes

decrypt(ctxt, nonce=None)[source]¶

Decrypt the given message, if a nonce is passed in attempt to decrypt it with the given nonce, otherwise assum that the nonce is attached to the message

encrypt(msg, nonce=None, pack_nonce=True)[source]¶

Encrypt the given message with the given nonce, if the nonce is not provided it will be generated from the libnacl.utils.rand_nonce function

class libnacl.public.PublicKey(pk)[source]¶

Bases: libnacl.base.BaseKey

This class is used to manage public keys

class libnacl.public.SecretKey(sk=None)[source]¶

Bases: libnacl.base.BaseKey

This class is used to manage keypairs

libnacl.secret module¶

Utilities to make secret box encryption simple

class libnacl.secret.SecretBox(key=None)[source]¶

Bases: libnacl.base.BaseKey

Manage symetric encryption using the salsa20 algorithm

decrypt(ctxt, nonce=None)[source]¶

Decrypt the given message, if no nonce is given the nonce will be extracted from the message

encrypt(msg, nonce=None)[source]¶

Encrypt the given message. If a nonce is not given it will be generated via the rand_nonce function

High level routines to maintain signing keys and to sign and verify messages

libnacl.utils module¶

libnacl.utils.load_key(path, serial='json')[source]¶

Read in a key from a file and return the applicable key object based on the contents of the file

libnacl.utils.rand_nonce()[source]¶

Generates and returns a random bytestring of the size defined in libsodium as crypto_box_NONCEBYTES

libnacl.utils.salsa_key()[source]¶

Generates a salsa2020 key

libnacl.utils.time_nonce()[source]¶

Generates and returns a nonce as in rand_nonce() but using a timestamp for the first 8 bytes.

This function now exists mostly for backwards compatibility, as rand_nonce() is usually preferred.

libnacl.version module¶

Module contents¶

Wrap libsodium routines

exception libnacl.CryptError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Base Exception for cryptographic errors

libnacl.crypto_auth(msg, key)[source]¶

Constructs a one time authentication token for the given message msg using a given secret key

libnacl.crypto_auth_verify(msg, key)[source]¶

Verifies that the given authentication token is correct for the given message and key

libnacl.crypto_box(msg, nonce, pk, sk)[source]¶

Using a public key and a secret key encrypt the given message. A nonce must also be passed in, never reuse the nonce

enc_msg = nacl.crypto_box(‘secret message’, <unique nonce>, <public key string>, <secret key string>)

libnacl.crypto_box_afternm(msg, nonce, k)[source]¶

Encrypts a given a message, using partial computed data

libnacl.crypto_box_beforenm(pk, sk)[source]¶

Partially performs the computation required for both encryption and decryption of data

libnacl.crypto_box_keypair()[source]¶

Generate and return a new keypair

pk, sk = nacl.crypto_box_keypair()

libnacl.crypto_box_open(ctxt, nonce, pk, sk)[source]¶

Decrypts a message given the receivers private key, and senders public key

libnacl.crypto_box_open_afternm(ctxt, nonce, k)[source]¶

Decrypts a ciphertext ctxt given k

libnacl.crypto_generichash(msg, key=None)[source]¶

libnacl.crypto_scalarmult_base(n)[source]¶

Computes and returns the scalar product of a standard group element and an integer “n”.

Generates a signing/verification key pair

libnacl.crypto_sign_open(sig, vk)[source]¶

Verifies the signed message sig using the signer’s verification key

libnacl.crypto_sign_seed_keypair(seed)[source]¶

Computes and returns the secret adn verify keys from the given seed

libnacl.crypto_stream(slen, nonce, key)[source]¶

Generates a stream using the given secret key and nonce

libnacl.crypto_stream_xor(msg, nonce, key)[source]¶

Encrypts the given message using the given secret key and nonce

The crypto_stream_xor function guarantees that the ciphertext is the plaintext (xor) the output of crypto_stream. Consequently crypto_stream_xor can also be used to decrypt

libnacl.crypto_verify_16(string1, string2)[source]¶

Compares the first crypto_verify_16_BYTES of the given strings

The time taken by the function is independent of the contents of string1 and string2. In contrast, the standard C comparison function memcmp(string1,string2,16) takes time that is dependent on the longest matching prefix of string1 and string2. This often allows for easy timing attacks.

libnacl.crypto_verify_32(string1, string2)[source]¶

Compares the first crypto_verify_32_BYTES of the given strings

The time taken by the function is independent of the contents of string1 and string2. In contrast, the standard C comparison function memcmp(string1,string2,16) takes time that is dependent on the longest matching prefix of string1 and string2. This often allows for easy timing attacks.

libnacl.randombytes(size)[source]¶

Return a string of random bytes of the given size

libnacl.randombytes_buf(size)[source]¶

Return a string of random bytes of the given size

libnacl.randombytes_close()[source]¶

Close the file descriptor or the handle for the cryptographic service provider

libnacl.randombytes_random()[source]¶

Return a random 32-bit unsigned value

libnacl.randombytes_stir()[source]¶

Generate a new key for the pseudorandom number generator

The file descriptor for the entropy source is kept open, so that the generator can be reseeded even in a chroot() jail.

libnacl.randombytes_uniform(upper_bound)[source]¶

Return a value between 0 and upper_bound using a uniform distribution

Return the minor version number
